entry.title: The Mirror Divide
entry.summary:
Author: LadyArkin

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,113Chapters: 4/15Kudos: 17

Summary: One ordinary night, Clark Wayne-Kent went to sleep in his bed. The next morning, his husband and children don’t recognize him. He has no baby. Their marriage never happened.Instead of choosing fear, Clark embraces the people that he loves and tries his best to hold his family together. Because they never came together in his new place, Clark never shared Kryptonian technology with Bruce. And the differences in that sequence of events have consequences.

entry.title: World's Finest
entry.summary:
Author: Salamence_373

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,480Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 32

Summary: Clark is new to Metropolis after landing his dream job as a journalist at the Daily Planet that's in a frenzy covering the new hero Superman that's moved to town. Bruce has been fighting as Batman for three years but still has a long way to go juggling his double life. These two have been searching for meaning as they strive towards their ultimate goals on an inevitable collision course. Their rivalry sparks new passion from both of them as they find out they aren't so different after all, while finding what's been missing from their lives. They each bring out the best in each other and make them better heroes and people as they build for a better tomorrow.

entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,401Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 8

Summary: When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesn’t expect to find himself face-to-face with the city’s true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clark’s resolve—only for Clark’s clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (“What the hay, are those fangs?”).Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to both—the golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesn’t break Bruce’s walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion.Their intimacy is charged and wordless: the monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.title: Temptation is One Hell of a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,677Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 112

Summary: Bruce Wayne never expected to walk into a church again—let alone with his four-year-old son in his arms. But when a meeting with Clark Kent, a priest. It turns into more than polite conversation, Bruce finds himself disarmed by a man who shouldn’t have surprised him at all. Clark is broad-shouldered, and impossibly kind; a believer in things Bruce turned his back on the day of his parents’ funeral.Bruce is skeptical, Clark is steadfast. Their ideologies clash from the moment they sit across from one another: billionaire pragmatism versus the faith of a priest. But somewhere between coloring books at Clark’s desk and quiet invitations to community fairs, a dangerous warmth grows. Bruce doesn’t know how to name it, and Clark doesn’t dare.Because whatever is happening between them—it shouldn’t. Bruce pushes, searching for the language he can’t bring himself to say aloud, while Clark whispers what he shouldn’t confess at all: I can’t. A vow binds him to the Church, but his heart betrays him in every secret meeting, every glance held too long.It shouldn’t work. It can’t work. But it does. And as much Clark Kent prays, temptation seeps through.

entry.title: The Outer Layers
entry.summary:
Author: aerey

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,576Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Bruce Wayne's life is a perfect, messy struggle. Raising five kids is no easy feat, but with the constant support from his found family (especially Alfred), they've been able to make do and every day he thanks whoever's out there for the life he has. However, Bruce is still, at the end of the day, alone. As CEO of Wayne Enterprises, coming home to an empty bed (except for when one of his kids has a nightmare) after a long day is something he tries not to think about too hard.It all changes when at the beginning of Dick's last and Jason's first year of high school when a new science teacher appears. Clark Kent is like no one Bruce has ever met and has a smile that could light up a dark room. However, as Bruce tries to get to know the man better, the shadows they both carry become evident. Some are old scars smoothed over and some are fresh wounds, waiting to fester and burst.The two are hopeless and awful at communicating, but some things are worth the effort, right?

entry.title: Bring Me To Life Again
entry.summary:
Author: iloveyaoibtw

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,332Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 46

Summary: His heartbeat stayed steady. Good. Because Bruce had never felt a flutter for anything. Clark forced down the seizing pain in his chest, lingering at the doorway for just a few seconds, knowing those deep blue eyes he had drowned in too long were watching him. Watching him carefully. As if, if he lingered even a little longer, he’d break and go back. The distance from him to Bruce was only seven steps.

entry.title: late dawns and early sunsets
entry.summary:
Author: beyondnic

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,244Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 175

Summary: It's about two hours later when Bruce starts to sneak away, accidentally waking Clark up. The room is silent and dark, a beautiful and peaceful darkness. Outside, Metropolis' night is no different, there's no intergalactic threat, no thugs out on the street, no Superman up on the sky, and no Batman lurking in the shadows either. Clark is too asleep to form a proper thought, so his immediate response to Bruce's escape attempt is to just place a steady hand on Bruce's bare hip, he gets closer and against his hair, he whispers: "Stay."Bruce knows Clark's not expecting him to, after all, he had never stayed before, he always managed to get away and run off to his bittersweet crime-ridden streets. And he knows Clark won't hold him hostage, it's an honest plea, a silent prayer, a vow of stability, a solemn compromise Bruce was unexpectedly willing to take.One word. Whispered. Only for him. "Okay."OrClark Kent and Bruce Wayne start dating and they try to juggle their secret identities and their personal lives.

entry.title: Black Hole Fantasy
entry.summary:
Author: callalypsolily

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,851Chapters: 0/15Kudos: 13

Summary: “Clark,” Bruce says fiercely. His fingers dig into Clark’s elbow, and it doesn’t hurt, no matter how much Clark wants it to. “Not everything is about chance or numbers. You might think there are hundreds of worlds out there where we can’t love each other, and that might be true. But this one, right here, right now, is one where we can.”Clark lets out a shuddering breath.“No,” he says, and he tries not to vomit at the look on Bruce’s face. “It isn’t.”***Kal-El was supposed to protect his baby cousin on the new world they had to call home, but by the time he arrived, Supergirl was more than capable of taking care of herself.Now Clark Kent is lonelier than he ever was in the Phantom Zone, and sometimes he wonders if it's just easier to get sucked into a black hole and be done with it.

entry.title: Averno
